Part 1: Template DNA Preparation

    Step 1.1: Preparation of single-stranded oligo DNA solutions

        Option 1.1.1: Dissolve synthesized single-stranded oligo DNA.
            - Component A: Synthesized single-stranded oligo DNA (Oligo-1, Oligo-2, Oligo-3, Oligo-4)
            - Component B: sterile distilled water
            (operational details: Dissolve each of the four synthesized single-stranded oligo DNAs (Oligo-1, Oligo-2, Oligo-3, Oligo-4) in sterile distilled water to a final concentration of 100 pmol/μl. These solutions will be used for annealing.)

    Step 1.2: Annealing of DNA oligonucleotides to form double-stranded templates

        Option 1.2.1: Prepare double-stranded sense chain template (Oligo-1/-2).
            - Component A: 10× Annealing Buffer
                - Recipe: 100 mM Tris-HCl (pH 8.0), 500 mM CH3COOK, 10 mM EDTA
            - Component B: 100 pmol/μl Oligo-1 solution
            - Component C: 100 pmol/μl Oligo-2 solution
            - Component D: Sterile water
            (operational details: In a PCR tube, combine 2 μl of 10× Annealing Buffer, 2 μl of 100 pmol/μl Oligo-1 solution, 2 μl of 100 pmol/μl Oligo-2 solution, and 14 μl of Sterile water for a total volume of 20 μl. Place the tube on a PCR amplifier. Heat at 95°C for 2 minutes. Gradually cool the mixture to 25°C over 45 minutes. Hold at 25°C for 10 minutes. The resulting solution contains the double-stranded oligo DNA solution (Oligo-1/-2) at a concentration of 10 pmol/μl. Store at -20°C.)

        Option 1.2.2: Prepare double-stranded anti-sense chain template (Oligo-3/-4).
            - Component A: 10× Annealing Buffer
                - Recipe: 100 mM Tris-HCl (pH 8.0), 500 mM CH3COOK, 10 mM EDTA
            - Component B: 100 pmol/μl Oligo-3 solution
            - Component C: 100 pmol/μl Oligo-4 solution
            - Component D: Sterile water
            (operational details: In a PCR tube, combine 2 μl of 10× Annealing Buffer, 2 μl of 100 pmol/μl Oligo-3 solution, 2 μl of 100 pmol/μl Oligo-4 solution, and 14 μl of Sterile water for a total volume of 20 μl. Place the tube on a PCR amplifier. Heat at 95°C for 2 minutes. Gradually cool the mixture to 25°C over 45 minutes. Hold at 25°C for 10 minutes. The resulting solution contains the double-stranded oligo DNA solution (Oligo-3/-4) at a concentration of 10 pmol/μl. Store at -20°C.)

Part 2: In Vitro Transcription for Single-Stranded RNA Synthesis

    Step 2.1: Assembly of the in vitro transcription reaction

        Option 2.1.1: Synthesize sense strand single-stranded RNA.
            - Component A: 10× Transcription Buffer
            - Component B: ATP Solution (50 mM)
            - Component C: GTP Solution (50 mM)
            - Component D: CTP Solution (50 mM)
            - Component E: UTP Solution (50 mM)
            - Component F: RNase Inhibitor (40 U/μl)
            - Component G: T7 RNA Polymerase (50 U/μl)
            - Component H: RNase-free dH2O
            - Component I: 10 pmol/μl double-stranded oligo DNA solution (Oligo-1/-2)
            (operational details: For a 20 μl reaction, combine 2 μl of 10× Transcription Buffer, 2 μl each of 50 mM ATP, GTP, CTP, and UTP solutions, 0.5 μl of RNase Inhibitor, 2 μl of T7 RNA Polymerase, and 6.5 μl of RNase-free dH2O. Mix gently. Finally, add 1 μl of the 10 pmol/μl double-stranded oligo DNA solution (Oligo-1/-2). The template DNA must be added last as the spermidine in the buffer can cause precipitation. Mix the final solution evenly and centrifuge briefly to collect the contents at the bottom of the tube.)

        Option 2.1.2: Synthesize anti-sense strand single-stranded RNA.
            - Component A: 10× Transcription Buffer
            - Component B: ATP Solution (50 mM)
            - Component C: GTP Solution (50 mM)
            - Component D: CTP Solution (50 mM)
            - Component E: UTP Solution (50 mM)
            - Component F: RNase Inhibitor (40 U/μl)
            - Component G: T7 RNA Polymerase (50 U/μl)
            - Component H: RNase-free dH2O
            - Component I: 10 pmol/μl double-stranded oligo DNA solution (Oligo-3/-4)
            (operational details: For a 20 μl reaction, combine 2 μl of 10× Transcription Buffer, 2 μl each of 50 mM ATP, GTP, CTP, and UTP solutions, 0.5 μl of RNase Inhibitor, 2 μl of T7 RNA Polymerase, and 6.5 μl of RNase-free dH2O. Mix gently. Finally, add 1 μl of the 10 pmol/μl double-stranded oligo DNA solution (Oligo-3/-4). The template DNA must be added last as the spermidine in the buffer can cause precipitation. Mix the final solution evenly and centrifuge briefly to collect the contents at the bottom of the tube.)

    Step 2.2: Incubation for RNA synthesis

        Option 2.2.1: Incubate the transcription reaction mixture.
            - (operational details: Incubate the reaction mixture from Step 2.1 at 42°C for 2 hours.)

Part 3: Nuclease Treatment

    Step 3.1: Nuclease digestion of the transcription reaction product

        Option 3.1.1: Template DNA removal using DNase I.
            - Component A: Transcription reaction product from Part 2
            - Component B: RNase-free DNase I (5 U/μl)
            (operational details: Add 2-4 μl of RNase-free DNase I (10-20 U total) to the 20 μl transcription reaction product. Mix well and incubate at 37°C for 30 minutes.)

        Option 3.1.2: Combined template DNA removal and RNA trimming using DNase I and RNase T1.
            - Component A: Transcription reaction product from Part 2
            - Component B: RNase-free DNase I (5 U/μl)
            - Component C: RNase T1 (4 U/μl)
                - Recipe: Dilute stock RNase T1 to 4 U/μl using RNase T1 Dilution Buffer. Use immediately.
            (operational details: To the transcription reaction product, add 2 μl of RNase-free DNase I and 1 μl of freshly diluted RNase T1 (4 U/μl). Mix well and incubate at 37°C for 2 hours.)

Part 4: Single-Stranded RNA Purification

    Step 4.1: Purification of the synthesized single-stranded RNA

        Option 4.1.1: Purification by Phenol/Chloroform Extraction and Isopropanol Precipitation.
            - Component A: Nuclease-treated transcription product from Part 3
            - Component B: RNase-free dH2O
            - Component C: phenol (pH 4.5)/chloroform/isoamyl alcohol (25:24:1)
            - Component D: chloroform/isoamyl alcohol (24:1)
            - Component E: 3 M sodium acetate
            - Component F: isopropanol
            - Component G: 80% ethanol
            - Component H: 1% RNase-free dH2O or TE Buffer
            (operational details: Adjust the volume of the nuclease-treated reaction to 100 μl with RNase-free dH2O. Add an equal volume (100 μl) of phenol (pH 4.5)/chloroform/isoamyl alcohol, vortex, and centrifuge at 12,000 rpm for 2 minutes at room temperature. Transfer the upper aqueous layer to a new tube. Add an equal volume of chloroform/isoamyl alcohol, vortex, and centrifuge at 12,000 rpm for 2 minutes at room temperature. Transfer the upper aqueous layer to a new tube. Add 1/10 volume of 3 M sodium acetate and an equal volume of isopropanol, mix, and let stand at room temperature for 5 minutes. Centrifuge at 15,000 rpm for 5 minutes. Discard the supernatant, wash the precipitate with 80% ethanol. Air dry the precipitate and dissolve it in an appropriate volume of 1% RNase-free dH2O or TE Buffer.)

        Option 4.1.2: Purification by Phenol/Chloroform Extraction and Ethanol Precipitation.
            - Component A: Nuclease-treated transcription product from Part 3
            - Component B: water-saturated acidic phenol/chloroform/isoamyl alcohol (25:24:1)
            - Component C: 5 M ammonium acetate (pH 5.6)
            - Component D: 99.5% ethanol
            - Component E: 80% ethanol
            - Component F: RNase Free dH2O
            (operational details: Add an equal volume of water-saturated acidic phenol/chloroform/isoamyl alcohol to the nuclease-treated reaction solution. Mix thoroughly and centrifuge at 10,000 rpm for 5 minutes at room temperature. Transfer the upper aqueous layer to a new tube. Add an equal volume of 5 M ammonium acetate (pH 5.6) and four times the volume of 99.5% ethanol. Let stand at room temperature for 5 minutes, then centrifuge at 15,000 rpm for 10 minutes. Discard the supernatant, wash the precipitate with 100 μl of 80% ethanol, and centrifuge at 15,000 rpm for 5 minutes. Discard the supernatant, briefly dry the precipitate, and dissolve in 20-50 μl of RNase Free dH2O.)
